search_results.snippet: A break in the Earth's crust is called a fault. According to Dictionary.com, a fault in geology is a fracture in the Earth's crust that results in the displacement and loss of continuity of rocks on either side of the fracture plane. A fault is the result of plate-tectonic forces.
